ARABIC: أَلْقِيَا فِى جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Cast each stubborn unbeliever into Hell," (they will be told),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The command was given: “Cast into Hell every hardened, stubborn unbeliever,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (They will be told,) "Throw into hell every persistent disbelievers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: It will be said to the angels, “Both of you fling every excessive ungrateful, stubborn person into hell.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (Allah will say to the angels:) "Both of you throw into Hell every stubborn disbeliever"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Do cast into hell every ungrateful, rebellious one,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Cast, you twain, into Gehenna every froward unbeliever,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (And it is said): Do ye twain hurl to hell each rebel ingrate,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Cast into Hell every ungrateful, rebellious one,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Cast ye twain into Hell every Person rebellious, contumacious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [The two angels accompany him will be told,] ‘Cast every obdurate ingrate into hell,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (The sentence will be:) "Throw, throw into Hell every contumacious Rejecter (of Allah)!-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (And it will be said): "Both of you throw (Order from Allah to the two angels) into Hell, every stubborn disbeliever (in the Oneness of Allah, in His Messengers, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: (It will be said): 'Indeed, cast into Gehenna (Hell) every deviating unbeliever,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Allah will say], "Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [50:24] ‘Cast into Hell (alqiyā: meaning [either] alqi alqi, ‘cast, cast …’ [to denote repetition], or [the emphatic form] alqiyan, ‘cast!’, which is the reading of al-Hasan [al-Basrī], in other words, the [final] nūn has been changed into an alif), every obdurate disbeliever, obstinate to the truth,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And Allah would say to him: (Do ye twain hurl to hell each rebel) who turns away from faith (ingrate) and who disbelieves in Allah, i.e. al-Walid Ibn al-Mughirah al-Makhzumi,
